clinical_study.brief_title: Tobramycin 300 mg Once-a-day (o.d.) Aerosol in Adults With Cystic Fibrosis
clinical_study.official_title: Tobramycin 300 mg o.d. Aerosol in in Adult Patients With Cystic Fibrosis: Pilot Study on Antimicrobial Activity

brief_summary.textblock: The study will include 10 adult patients with cystic fibrosis. The aim of the study is to evaluate whether Tobramycin 300 mg aerosol once-a-day for 28 days can reduce the bacterial load in the airways. Secondary end-point is the evaluation of variation in bacterial susceptibility during and at the end of study period.

detailed_description.textblock: Ten adult patients with cystic fibrosis will be enrolled in a stable phase and will received prophylaxis with aerosol of Tobramycin 300 mg once a day for 28 days.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Outpatients, male and female, age range 18-45 years
- Diagnosis of cystic fibrosis
- FEV1 >50% predicted.
- sputum samples available
- Chest x ray negative for pneumonia and tuberculosis
- Informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Allergy to tobramycin
- Use of systemic steroids in the previous 2 weeks
- Pregnancy or breast feeding
- Treatment with other experimental drug in the previous 3 months
